edu.bonn.cs.wmp.awarenesswidgets
Interface WMPAwarenessWidget

All Known Implementing Classes:
RadarView
public interface WMPAwarenessWidget

This interface defines all methods necessary for any WMPAwarenessWidget. Don't get confused with the class AwarenessWidget get from the CEFX project which is used as a super-class for view updaters. This class shall be used as a hub between CEFX and WMP whereas the WMPAwarenessWidget implementations get their changes directly from the WMPViews (subject view) which enables them to also get notified about changes not being managed by CEFX like viewports. For an example implementation take a look at RadarView. TODO: find a better name for the AwarenessWidget interface from the CEFX project

Author:
Sven Bendel

Method Detail

onViewContentChange

void onViewContentChange(ContentChange c)
This method is called by the subject view of this Awareness Widget when its content changes.

Parameters:
c - ContentChange incorporating informations about the changed state of the subject view.

isInterestedIn

boolean isInterestedIn(Class<? extends ContentChange> changeClass)
This method is called by the subject view of this Awareness Widget when its content changes, but before the ContentChange is propagated to the Awareness Widget. We may decide if we want to get informed about this particular ContentChange by returning true or false.

Parameters:
c - ContentChange incorporating informations about the changed state of the subject view.

setSubjectView

void setSubjectView(WMPView v)
This method allows the manual setting/changing of the view this Awareness Widget receives it's ContentChange objects from. Normally this should be something simple like this.subject = (View) v; invalidate();

Parameters:
v - The WMPView which will eventually all ContentChanges to this awareness widget.
